news.title: Chandigarh civic body puts non-compliant board outside four societies
news.para: Earlier, Chandigarh Pollution Control Committee (CPCC) also served notices under Section 5 of the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 for non-compliance of Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016 to these four societies.

news.title: Ludhiana: Rebate ends, few property tax defaulters come forward to pay dues
news.para: At some of the suvidha centres, one or two persons were seen making the one-time payment. Officials said 1,313 people filed their returns and Rs 44.35 lakh property tax amount was recovered on Tuesday.

news.title: Investcorp exits from INDIS Group's project in Hyderabad
news.para: Investcorp Score Fund invested Rs 135 crore in 2017 into the PBEL city project being developed by INDIS.

news.title: Pune: Gunthewari scheme relief for merged villages
news.para: The city improvement committee (CIC) of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has given a nod for regularization of these properties.

news.title: HC allows Andhra Pradesh govt's appeal against Navaratnalu-Pedalandiriki Illu scheme order
news.para: As the petitioners submitted that they do not have any problem with the scheme if the government allot house sites to them, the high court, without going into the merits of the single judge order, allowed the appeal petition.

news.title: Plea in Madars HC against illegal sand mining in Vellar river
news.para: A division bench of Justices Pushpa Sathyanarayana and P Velmurugan was hearing a public interest litigation filed (PIL) by A Palanivelu, a resident of Sathanur village.

news.title: Kolkata HC seeks KMRC report on Central Park metro construction
news.para: KMRC is the implementing agency of the Rs 8,575-crore East-West corridor which, currently stretches 7 km from Sector V to Phoolbagan and will eventually cover 16 km till Howrah Maidan via the Hooghly river.

news.title: Coimbatore: Town planning officials give nod for building on disputed plot
news.para: The building approval, which was given in 2016, was cancelled by the then corporation commissioner in 2019 after learning that the approval was obtained by fabricating documents.

news.title: Delhi: Construction workers march to demand welfare policy to tackle bans
news.para: After lifting the ban on November 22, the Delhi government reimposed it on construction and demolition activities last Thursday following a Supreme Court order.

news.title: OTS scheme for defaulting Yamuna expressway plot allottees extended up to Dec 31
news.para: The scheme was drawing to a close on November 30, but the extension of another month has been provided to the allottees to seek the benefits being offered, officials have said.

news.title: Chandigarh administration plots freehold talks as MHA team visits in December
news.para: The administration had recently written to the ministry for giving in-principle nod for conversion of leasehold properties into freehold. Pal had then met MHA officials and raised the demand.

news.title: Vadodara: Harsh Developers told to return advance for not giving shop's possession
news.para: Bhatia had booked a shop in Krishna Shri scheme floated by Harsh Developers and paid Rs 5 lakh. The builder promised possession of the shop by September 2018.

news.title: Gurugram development body wants use of more recycled water at building sites
news.para: ​At present, less than 4% of the recycled wastewater gets used in construction sites, which means the industry takes up a significant share of freshwater that is already scarce.

news.title: CBI books Hyderabad's Prithiviram Infra & its directors for Rs 8 crore fraud
news.para: The firm, represented by its partners Undavalli Raja Gopal and Boppudi Seshagiri Rao, had availed a secured overdraft facility of Rs 4 crore and letter of credit (LC) of Rs 2 crore, with a total limit of Rs 6 crore in October 2016 for business purposes from Union Bank of India’s Defence Colony Branch in Hyderabad.

news.title: Karnataka government to launch digital wallet to store property records
news.para: The project has been taken up by the centre for smart governance (CSG), a wholly owned subsidiary of the Karnataka government. The intent of the project — named Kaveri blockchain — is to digitise and authenticate all land records in the state.
